etymology.description: semantic: 氵(氵) (shuǐ, "water") + phonetic: 谷(谷) (gǔ, "valley") = valley filled with water -> bathe
etymology.interpretation: The character 浴(浴) (yù, "bathe") combines the semantic component 氵(氵) (shuǐ, "water") indicating relation to liquid and the phonetic component 谷(谷) (gǔ, "valley"). This suggests a place where water collects, such as a valley filled with water, an apt metaphor for bathing.

examples.chinese: 他在浴室里洗澡(他在浴室裡洗澡)。
黄昏时他在温泉浴池中沐浴(黃昏時他在溫泉浴池中沐浴)，忘却一天烦恼(忘卻一天煩惱)。
examples.pinyin: Huánghūn shí tā zài wēnquán yùchí zhōng mùyù, wàngquè yītiān fánnǎo.
examples.english: At dusk, he bathes in the hot spring pool and forgets the troubles of the day.

examples.chinese: 她享受晨浴后的清新(她享受晨浴後的清新)。
examples.pinyin: Tā xiǎngshòu chén yù hòu de qīngxīn.
examples.english: She enjoys the freshness after her morning bath.
